text: Roblox will not allow you

to directly transfer
Robux to another account,
so instead we will distribute funds
from a sellable group item.
Click on the hamburger menu
in the top left side of the screen
and select "Groups."
Click on "Store,"
and then click on your sellable object.
This takes you to the item's page.
Click on the three-dots drop-down menu
and select "Delete from Inventory."

This removes the item from
your personal inventory,

allowing you to purchase
it from the group store.

To purchase the item, select
the green "Buy" button.
Since it's a group item,

the money you spend on that
item will go to your group.
There are a couple things to keep in mind
about this process.
First, Roblox takes 30% of every purchase.
Second, when buying clothes,

Roblox has a three- to
seven-day waiting period

before the money is actually
added to group funds.
Go back to your group's page
by clicking on the hamburger menu
in the top left side of the screen.
Click "Groups."
Now click on the three-dot drop-down menu
and select "Configure Group."
You will see a list of options
on the left of the screen near the top.
Hover your mouse over the "Revenue" tab.
This will summon a pop-up tab.
Select "Payouts."

You have the option of
setting up a recurring payment
or a one-time payment.

We will show you the
one-time-payment method here.

Select the "One-time Payout"
tab at the top of your screen.
You can transfer funds as

a percentage of the total
amount of the group funds
or a specific amount.

Next, click on the "Add
Payout Recipients" box

to select the group account to
which you want to send funds.

Add the username of the
account into the pop-up window.
Be sure to put the account's username,
not the display name,
to make sure that you're sending Robux
to the right account.
On the next screen,

enter the amount of Robux
you want to distribute
and click "Distribute."

The Robux might take
a few minutes to send,

and the person you send them
to might have to reload Roblox
in order to see the received Robux.
